content:
The Act titled "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 2005" increases rates of disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 2005" raises rates of disability compensation in various subsections of title 38, United States Code. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 2005" increases disability compensation rates in different subsections of title 38, United States Code, by adjusting specific monetary values. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 2005" increases disability compensation rates for dependents and certain disabled veterans in various subsections of title 38, United States Code. This includes adjustments to additional compensation for dependents, clothing allowance for disabled veterans, and dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. Section 1311(a) of title 38 is amended to increase compensation rates for dependents and disabled veterans. The table in paragraph (3) is also amended accordingly. If the veteran held high-ranking positions, the surviving spouse's rate is $1,271. If the veteran served in specific leadership roles, the rate increases to $2,365. Additional adjustments are made to DIC benefits for children and disabilities, increasing the amounts in various subsections. Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for children is also updated with higher rates for different scenarios. DIC benefits for children are increased in subsections (a), (b), and (c) to $257, $438, and $218 respectively. These changes will take effect on December 1, 2005. Additionally, the Secretary has the authority to adjust disability compensation rates for certain individuals not receiving compensation under chapter 11 of title 38, United States Code.
